Posts.Content:
Hi there, I am new to this site and have posted maybe a few times. After reading this thread, I am nervous about
 having the bilateral mastectomy and the after affects that it can cause. Am I most likely to have this? I also have fibromyalgia. I have DCSI and because it is a secondary cancer due to radiation treatments, it needs to be done. Any tips on what to prepare for? Does anyone have body pillows? What should I have on hand for recovery?
Thanks
Lisa
Fibromyalgia, GERD, Iron deficient anemia, ADD, and15 yrs. survivor of Hodgkin's Disease.

Posts.Content:

I am preparing for my right expander to be put back in and then both left and right expander will start expanding 
 SO....my question is what should I expect for pain when they are in the process of expansion. soreness, pain, achiness? so sorry for all the questions. Just feeling alittle anxious.
Lisa
Posts.Title: reconstruction pain

Posts.Content:
I needed the right expander removed in August due to a staph infection and due to have it put back in on the 10th. Have any of you had it fail again and not gone through reconstruction. Am I more likely to get an infection? thanks for your input.
Lisa
Posts.Title: expanders and infection

Posts.Content:
Hi Northwind,
Alot has happened since I last posted. I had the expander put back in and everything was good. I also had the implants put in on Feb 2 and everything has healed well. They did take out alot of scar tissue so I am still sore and tired. I meet with my dr again at the end of the month and will have the nipple reconstruction in May. If you have any questions, let me know.
Lisa
Posts.Title: expanders and infection

Posts.Content:
Hi Puppylover,
Yes, I am usually on the fibro site. Thank you for the advice and input. Did it affect your fibro? My husband has been a big help as well as my kids.... 8, 11yrs. My surgery is scheduled for 2 weeks from now. Waiting has been torture and my anxiety is through the roof. I am working on that though. My husband is taking three weeks off after my surgery and I am working on dinners to freeze. I think I am going to get a body pillow.
They are also having to take out the centinal node on the right side. This is a secondary cancer from radiation from the Hodgkin's lymphoma I had 15 yrs ago.
I keep telling myself that I got through it once, and can do it again.
Thanks for listening.
lisa

Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Hi there...My name is Lisa and I was diagnosed with DCSI in the right breast two days ago. My situation is different. I have a high risk of Breast cancer because I had hodgkin's disease and was treated with radiation. That was 20 yrs ago and it was told to me that I have a higher risk of Breast cancer. And now having breast cancer at 43 the drs state that my age also poses a high risk. Now here is my possibilities:
Typically the treatment is lumpectomy and radiation but radiation is not an option because it has been previously radiated. So they said that I could have the lumpectomy and take hormone meds but I am still at a higher risk of reoccurance. Or...
I could have a masectomy possibly double because I am at high risk again. My head is spinning so if this sounds scattered, I am sorry. I am looking for guidance and wonder what other people have done in a similar situation.
Thanks
Lisa
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Thanks.
Lisa
Fibromyalgia, GERD, Iron deficient anemia, ADD, and15 yrs. survivor of Hodgkin's Disease.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Tailia,
I have had time to think about
 things...overload of information. I need a double mastectomy. I am very anxious because they cannot do it until July. Waiting will not affect the outcome of surgery but waiting is very difficult for me. The anxiety of waiting is crazy. I have good days and better days
Thanks Tailia!
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
hi Anxiety,
I also suffer from anxiety and also from depression. I have been recently diagnosed with breast cancer, DCSI, and because of my history of also having Hodgkin's disease, my treatment is different. I need a double mastectomy. I am very anxious because they cannot do it until July. Waiting will not affect the outcome of surgery but waiting is very difficult for me. Anxiety at its high and low. Tailia is right. Let yourself experience the ups and downs but try not to stay in the moment. Take a walk, listen to music, start a hobby(mine is making cards and scrapbooking) and keep your mind occupied. I know better said than done. I wanted to have a 2 yr old tantrum over the weekend. Take care of yourself! 
Lisa
Lisa
Fibromyalgia, GERD, Iron deficient anemia, ADD, and15 yrs. survivor of Hodgkin's Disease.

Posts.Title: Update

Posts.Content:
Hi there,
I had a double mastectomy 4 months ago. I do not need radiation and chemo. I am feeling increasing pain, I think nerve pain. It is like a shock across where my breasts are. I needed the right expander removed in August due to a staph infection and due to have it put back in on the 10th. Is this normal to have increase pain? Sometimes it takes me by surprise. 
Thank you for any feedback and let me know if you have any recommendations as to how to minimize it.
Thanks
Lisa
